channel.title: [PI] Cant edit some Interface text in Client.java(server side)

item.title: [PI] Cant edit some Interface text in Client.java(server side)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:17, topic:521702”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=640214.msg4315904#msg4315904 date=1371486905]

That’s not from anything I said. Read up on T1-T2 errors:
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/114399-client-errors-what-numbers-mean.html

Yes it is. It’s from packet 126, so it’s a problem from the code that you gave him (I suggest you read up on T1-T2 errors)

It isn’t because of my code. Because I’ve used that exact code before, but with a different set of IDs.
[/quote]
Exactly, you’re assigning text to an ID that doesn’t exist.[/quote]
I used the exact same code for my report abuse interface (I couldn’t figure out some of the ID’s)
I had it run through 300 different lines. I’m sorry but if he’s getting T2’s on 60 lines of code compared to me getting no errors on 300 lines, there’s an obvious issue, and it wasn’t caused by me.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Cant edit some Interface text in Client.java(server side)

Yes it is. It’s from packet 126, so it’s a problem from the code that you gave him (I suggest you read up on T1-T2 errors)
[/quote]

Exactly, you’re assigning text to an ID that doesn’t exist.

item.title: [PI] Cant edit some Interface text in Client.java(server side)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You can always edit them. I don’t know why you’re having an issue.
Sometimes the client will save the data, so if you reload it you’re fine. As long as you compiled the changes in the server

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cant edit some Interface text in Client.java(server side)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Seriously do something like:

for(int i = 6930; i < 7000; i++){
getPA().sendFrame126( "ID: "+ Interger.toString(i), i);
}

Edit: I say this because not all ID’s you see in Lins are the same as you’d use in the server. idk why but that’s been the case for me before.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cant edit some Interface text in Client.java(server side)
item.dc:creator: @Celeron Celeron
item.description:
@Celeron wrote:

Hello Moparscapians

i wanted to edit a inteface but it wont let me edit every text on it just some…

public void wildyWarning() {
	getPA().sendFrame126("Welcome to ZetarPvP!", 6940);
	//clearQuestInterface();
	getPA().sendFrame126("@whi@Welcome on ZetarPvP" +playerName+ "!\nYou currently have @red@" +pkPoints+ "@whi@ Pk Points!\nYour Killcount is: @red@" +killCount+ "@whi@!", 6939);
	getPA().sendFrame126("@whi@ZetarPvP is a Pking-Server, use your Pk-Tab to level-up!\nTo change your defence level click on its icon in the Skill-Tab!", 6941);
	getPA().sendFrame126("Register at our forums @red@www.ZetarPvP.net.\n-Team Zetar", 6942);
	getPA().showInterface(1908);
	}

it edits the Text with the id 6940 and 6942 but it doesnt edit 6941 and 6939 but i know that these are the ids, because i looked it up with the interface editor!

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Cant edit some Interface text in Client.java(server side)
